intro: Racosperma atkinsianum, commonly known as the narrow-leaf acacia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, characterized by its pod fruits and nitrogen-fixing ability. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, featuring compound leaves with numerous small leaflets. Its flowers are usually yellow or pale yellow, arranged in dense, spherical clusters. Racosperma atkinsianum is well adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, making it a resilient species in harsh climates.
